name: Not for profit
text:
It is declared to be the policy of the State that the housing and community development corporation of Hawaii shall carry out its responsibilities under this part in an efficient manner so as to enable it to fix the sales prices and rentals for residential lots at the lowest possible rates consistent with the purpose of this part; and that the corporation shall not administer this part for profit, or as a source of revenue to the State.  To this end, the corporation shall fix the sales prices for residential lots or rentals for lots at no higher rates or prices than it shall find to be necessary in order to produce revenues which (together with all other available moneys, revenues, income, and receipts of the corporation from whatever sources derived under the administration of this part) will be sufficient:  (1) to pay, as the same becomes due, the principal and interest on the bonds of the corporation; (2) to meet the cost of, and to provide for the administration of this part; and (3) to create a reserve sufficient to meet the largest principal and interest payments which will be due on such bonds in any one year thereafter and to maintain such reserve. [L 1967, c 307, §21; HRS ; am L 1987, c 337, §16; am L 1988, c 104, §2; am L 1997, c 350, §14]

To this end, the administration shall fix the sales prices for residential lots or rentals for lots at no higher rates or prices than it shall find to be necessary in order to produce revenues which (together with all other available moneys, revenues, income, and receipts of the administration from whatever sources derived under the administration of this part) will be sufficient:  (1) to pay, as the same becomes due, the principal and interest on the bonds of the administration; (2) to meet the cost of, and to provide for the administration of this part; and (3) to create a reserve sufficient to meet the largest principal and interest payments which will be due on such bonds in any one year thereafter and to maintain such reserve. [L 1967, c 307, §21; HRS ; am L 1987, c 337, §16; am L 1988, c 104, §2; am L 1997, c 350, §14; am L 2005, c 196, §26(b)]
